greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of ways to divide the partitions of n into nonempty consecutive subsequences each of which contains only equal parts and parts from distinct subsequences differ by at least k; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
comment: T(n,k) is defined for n,k >= 0. The triangle contains terms with k <= n. T(n,k) = T(n,n) = A000005(n) for k >= n.  For k>0: T(n,k) = number of partitions of n in which any two distinct parts differ by at least k, or, equivalently, T(n,k) = number of partitions of n in which each part, with the possible exception of the largest, occurs at least k times.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
formula: G.f. of column k: 1 + Sum_{j>=1} x^j/(1-x^j) * Product_{i=1..j-1} (1+x^(k*i)/(1-x^i)).
maple: b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<1, 0,
b(n, i-1, k) +add(b(n-i*j, i-k, k), j=1..n/i)))
mathematica: b[n_, i_, k_] :=  b[n, i, k] =  If[n == 0, 1, If[i < 1, 0,  b[n, i - 1, k] + Sum[b[n - i*j, i - k, k], {j, 1, n/i}]]]; T[n_, k_] := b[n, n, k]; Table[Table[T[n, k], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 27 2013, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Nov 04 2012
